prefix: Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in engineering would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in engineering would. Find the units digit of $16^{17} \times 17^{18} \times 18^{19}$.
gpt_response:
To find the units digit of the given expression, we will first examine the units digits of each of the numbers involved.

For \(16^{17}\), the units digit is 6 raised to an odd power, which means the units digit will also be 6.

For \(17^{18}\), the units digit is 7 raised to an even power, which means the units digit will be 1.

For \(18^{19}\), the units digit is 8 raised to an odd power, which means the units digit will be 8.

Now, when we multiply the units digits together: \(6 \times 1 \times 8 = 48\), the units digit of the result will be 8.

Therefore, the units digit of \(16^{17} \times 17^{18} \times 18^{19}\) is 8.
solution_prompt:
